title: Thoughts on a Silent Night
author: Li Bai
content: Before my bed, the moon shines bright,
I suspect it is frost on the ground.
I raise my head to gaze at the moon,
I lower my head and think of my hometown.

title: Spring Dawn
author: Meng Haoran
content: I slept through spring unaware of dawn,
Everywhere I hear birds singing.
In the night came the sound of wind and rain,
Who knows how many flowers have fallen.

title: Climbing the Stork Tower
author: Wang Zhihuan
content: The white sun rests on mountain tops,
The Yellow River flows into the sea.
To see a thousand miles farther,
Climb one more floor of the tower.

title: Longing
author: Wang Wei
content: Red beans grow in southern lands,
In spring how many branches appear.
I wish you would gather many,
This thing reminds of deepest longing.

title: Viewing the Waterfall at Mount Lu
author: Li Bai
content: Sunlight strikes the incense burner, producing purple smoke,
In the distance, a waterfall hangs over the front river.
Water flows straight down three thousand feet,
As if the Milky Way were falling from the ninth heaven.
